website_summaries.verdict: The SanDisk Extreme Pro UHS-I microSD card delivers the fastest speeds we've seen, but current mobile devices and applications can't make the most of it.
pros: The fastest microSD card we've tested

customer_reviews.title: defective SD card
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a good SD card. I lost half of my photos and videos from Disney World because of this card. I have the Mirrorless Sony a6000. I had to send it in because i thought the camera was the problem but it ended up being the SD card. Every time I took a video, it was slow to allow me to take pics (15-30 seconds), and deleted all the pictures that were taken immediately after the videos. It was slow to process anything. Thanks to amazon, they refunded me the money for this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Branda

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk 64GB SD Card Failed After 13 Months, But They Replaced On It On Warranty Free of Charge.
customer_reviews.text: The Sandisk 64GB SD card worked fine for 13 months and then developed an i/o error resulting in total loss of ability to transfer files to or from the card. I have contacted Sandisk for replacement by terms of their warranty. They require purchase records (thanks Amazon), card serial number (infinitely small on card back side) and photos showing the legible serial number. After submission of initial requirements they ask a series of additional questions. If Sandisk upholds their warranty with a replacement SD card, I will update this review. It took a few weeks to work through the Sandisk warranty replacement process, but they did replace my failed 64GB Sandisk SD card free of charge. Thank you Sandisk.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun

customer_reviews.title: For good.
customer_reviews.text: When I'm shooting, reliability is a 100% requirement. It is not a suggestion, it is not a fancy word I bandy about for a giggle. It is Required. So when this card starts dumping directories and entire blocks of files, and I lose half of a day's work on shoots I can't get repeats or callbacks on? That drops this card to the absolute BOTTOM of the rung. Sandisk has burned me now at least twice, three times if you count the incredible failures of their MicroSD cards a few years back. I'm done with this company. For good.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Watch the sku codes!!!! Wrong 4 times.
customer_reviews.text: Soooo.... there are 2 versions of this card, one with v30 and one without. Without is older. That is the one listed with this review. It costs on average $40 more than new ones. So if you need the newer cards, you are paying far more here. If you knew it than check and I bet you got the v30 version. My particular situation requires older model cards. On 4th try I even had the rep repeat to me the sku I wanted. BUT!!! Whomever put the bar code over SanDisks sku code put the wrong one on, the sticker is right until you look at the box sku.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Possible fraudulent card...appears not SanDisk as labeled
customer_reviews.text: Possible fraudulent card. Read on. Malfunctioning and past return deadline. I was traveling and didn’t use during time to return. Now, trying to save to card, and says file is too big. Checked storage available and file not too big; and, not locked. Went to SanDisk to register so could request replacement. Directed to find serial number on back of card...NO SERIAL NUMBER!!! Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: The cards performed well in my Canon 70D for 1-1/2 years. Then, about a month ago, the top left edge above the lock broke off. I thought this was just "one of those things," but the same thing happened to the other card today. Fortunately, I got all of my photos off the card before it crapped out on me. I have used this style of card since the first MMC cards came out in the early 2000s and I never had one physically break like this.
customer_reviews.author: Horace

customer_reviews.title: I've since bought a real one in store at a real camera shop and it's a wonderful card, too bad the originals were fake little ...
customer_reviews.text: The ones I received were fakes. DO NOT ORDER frustration free packaging, they are almost certain to be fakes. They worked for a second before crapping out almost immediately, and the pictures don't save. I've since bought a real one in store at a real camera shop and it's a wonderful card, too bad the originals were fake little plastics. Frustration free packaging is a horrible idea, pay the same price for opened memory cards?? I ordered mine a while ago as backups but I tried them out and realized I've been duped too late to return them. Lost some good photos during a professional shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Khan

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: 2 out 3 cards Failed Immediately in my Camera
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these SanDisk memory cards for my Nikon D750 which has 2 memory slots. One card began to fail immediately in either slot of the camera so I returned it for a replacement. The replacement SD card also immediately failed in either slot All of my other cards work fine, including the first one from the original order. So, I am wondering if these are counterfeit cards or perhaps a bad batch of cards. Also, on the second failed card, I was only getting a transfer speed of 5 MB/s with my USB 3.0 card reader. Whereas, the non-defective card is close to the 95 MB/s speed it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: Papatone

customer_reviews.title: FAKE SD Card DO NOT purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this card to have a local backup on my laptop. After about 6 months the card stopped working. I run my own IT business so I tried the card in a different reader and it didn't work. I contacted SanDisk to warranty the product. After sending pictures to them they determined the card is a FAKE. THIS IS NOT AN ORIGINAL SanDisk card. I attempted to contact the seller and they never responded. I contacted Amazon and thankfully they stood behind the card. AGAIN SanDisk the supposed manufacturer is NOT SANDISK.
customer_reviews.author: Rog Kipp

customer_reviews.title: new sandisk unreliable and lifetime warranty is BS, not honored
customer_reviews.text: I wrote for warranty request/exchange a month ago and no reply. complete radio silence. this thing has been giving me intermittent unreadable errors for months. I've previously owned 6 or 8 different 2gb thru 8gb sandisk sd cards and they were perfect for years. seems to be since western digital bought them out... bummer
customer_reviews.author: alyson

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I use a canon 70d and I shoot in raw almost most of the time so ofc space is limited. But I only shoot at home for right now so this works perfectly for me! If i shoot in JPEG I got a lot of space to work with. I never shoot video unless it’s videos of my niece. This little card works like magic and I like it. Now ofc if you’re doing video or you’re a getting paid for photography & you need something more reliable then go get something more expensive. But for the most part, this candle professional needs too! Love this card!
customer_reviews.author: SelenaQ4ever

customer_reviews.title: Good SD card...
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty quick and has lasted a long time for me. Now I just keep an eye out for deep sales and buy 32GB or 64GB cards. You're paying for the words "Extreme PRO". it is good but if you are a serious photographer, wait out the sales at best Buy or B and H, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product but.....
customer_reviews.text: 07/11/18 - Great product from past experience. Big issue is when my orders are delivered, they never ever ring my door bell even though I had requested it numerous times. So, this SD Card sat on my porch in the scorching heat for hours (100F feels like 110F) & visible to anyone passing by due to the large white padded envelope-It could have been stolen. If this memory card is corrupt due to exposure to the extreme heat (we’re in a heat advisory today in Kansas), I will send it back to Amazon for a full refund. I hope Amazon reads our feedbacks and solves customers issues. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Orly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent storage expansion
customer_reviews.text: Excellent storage expansion for HP Streaming Notebook (insert into SD card port). In addition to data storage, many programs can be installed to and executed from this card. For better organization and to separate data from programs, create an "SD Programs" folder for these installations. Tips: 1) For every program installation, save the installation file, etc., in another folder such as "SD ProgramsBU" (BU = backup). This facilitates easier re-installation later if necessary (and program removal does not delete these files). 2) If backup software does not include this drive (SD card) during backup, just copy & paste it to the backup drive (and avoid proprietary format created by some backup software). ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Holland

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 2 SD cards for a recent trip and was well pleased with them
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use SanDisk brand whether for SD cards or compact flash. I purchased 2 SD cards for a recent trip and was well pleased with them. The 95MB/s speed was recommended for the 7D Mark II, and the 32md size is adequate for my needs currently. I haven't taken any videos since all my grand children got big enough to walk. However, that may change as they are becoming more proficient at basketball and pitching a softball.
customer_reviews.author: BillD

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This held over 250 converted slides, which I could now edit with PhotoShop. Since these are new acquisitions I do not know how long they will last. But being able to store deteriorating slides on the card, and with PhotoShop allowed me to preserve and correct the slides to very good quality for family on a small card; I can duplicate the card for those that want them. Good product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The card I use and can trust.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty much the only type of as card I use. Haven’t had one fail on me yet (crossing my fingers because you never know). The extreme pro line is great. They aren’t too expensive and they always come with a code for a free several months/year subscription to sandisks recovery program. I’ve never used it, but again would never hurt to try it out since it’s free. I suggest getting at least two, because again you never know when the corruption fairy will visit. Unless you’ll be shooting for hours, a couple 16GB cards will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this now for about a year and it has worked just fine. These are of far better quality than the Pro Grade brand I tried hoping to save a little money. I very strongly recommend the SanDisk Extreme PRO cards over the PRO GRADE brand. These will perform for you every time while the other will leave you in the lurch.
customer_reviews.author: Scott  Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Lightning fast and rock solid in my Nikon D750.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for the slightly different version of these that I bought that didn't function with my D750, and these cards work great! Rated as the fastest cards available for the Nikon D750, and they live up to it. Nice and sturdy, heavier than the usual SD Cards from other manufacturers, and backed up by a good warranty. They also come with a 2-year subscription to Sandisk's rescue software, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: slushiercashew

customer_reviews.title: Great card passed efficiency test, A must!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... I now test any SD cards immediately after opening the package. There's allot of fakes flooding the market ... Usually if you're dealing directly with Amazon you're basically safe. But this card is on the money. This card has a high capacity and handles large volumes quickly and efficiently. Testing the card pass with flying colors. There are some bad apples out there. Anyway, this is a great SD card. No I won't get in the technical part of it. But, crunching the numbers with software designed to do such was an advantage in making sure things are right. Well worth the extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Muzik

customer_reviews.title: Fastest card I've ever found - sustained 90 MB/s read, 72 MB/s write
customer_reviews.text: I've used high performance SD cards from multiple providers, and SanDisk's Extreme Pro line are the fastest I've found. They consistently perform at high speeds, both on my computer in tests and in my camera. However, they're also the most expensive card I've found, and by not a small margin. In tests on my MacBook Pro, this gets sustained read speeds of about 90 MB/s, and sustained write speeds of 72 MB/s. However, there are cards that achieve speeds very near these for a much lower cost - I recently purchased a Samsung Pro card that's only a few MB/s slower, but costs half as much. Knowing that, I'm not sure I'd buy one of these cards again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great card for GoPro, buy from reputable seller.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my GoPro Hero 5 Black. Get a quality SD card, folks... You need decent write speeds for newer 4K recording devices, so you need to be careful which model memory card you purchase (Extreme Pro, Pro, etc...). Buy directly from Amazon or a reputable seller, as there are too many counterfeit flash memory cards going around. Just remember, if the price is too good to be true, and you look at the seller and it says "Just Launched," then it's too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Seanguy

customer_reviews.title: I feel like if you're considering spending the extra money to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel like if you're considering spending the extra money to buy Sandisk brand SD cards, reliability is important to you. Let me set your mind to rest by agreeing with the masses of reviews. This SD card is reliable. And personally, since I entrust my priceless, irreplaceable memories to these things, reliability is worth any additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Courtnic2Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Better check it when you get it.
customer_reviews.text: The card I received was counterfeit. I have ordered a bunch of these cards in the past, and this is the first time I received one without the serial numbers and "Made in China" engraved on the back. It has the dreaded yellow tab. And most of all, when I put it in my camera, it can't keep up on continuous shooting the way the authentic cards do. Plus, when I put it in my computer, it says it has 133gb of space.
customer_reviews.author: DRon15

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Sony a7R II shooting RAW
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my Sony a7R II. I was looking at the next speed up but based on the user manual of the camera it looked like the next speed up wasn't supported so I figured it wasn't worth the extra money. I am able to shoot burst shots and have yet to get an error message about the buffer being full and have to wait for the camera to write to the card. I shoot in RAW as well, so thats 40-50 MB files and doing burst shots. I have shot probably 5 thousand pictures so far and have been very pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: fishie20

customer_reviews.title: Very high-end card.
customer_reviews.text: No hiccups when recording HD slow-mo and regular 4k video with my GH4 camera. Good product. I only wish SanDisk had a better naming convention in distinguishing their low-to-high-end cards. This one is "Extreme PRO", but below it there is "Extreme Plus" and then "Extreme" then "Ultra Plus", "Ultra". It can get confusing until you search up the read/write speeds, which is what matters. Made the mistake of buying the best SanDisk card carried at my local Walgreens, which was the "Ultra Plus" but it wasn't quick enough for my video recording needs. (Still use it for photos though!) Overall, good quality card.
customer_reviews.author: qxAngelxp

customer_reviews.title: Great Reliable Card, But Be Gentle
customer_reviews.text: I've been using SanDisk cards for years. They are reliable, well-priced and good for shooting HD video as well. The only thing to look out for is due to slim design be gentle when inserting or removing from the camera or card reader. After a couple of years (and not being super careful) the edge started bending and splitting. It still works fine but can get a little stuck when removing.
customer_reviews.author: Balazs

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Using this card for my Canon DSLR. Records 1080p with no issues. Basically no buffering from the memory card during continuous shooting. I also do long exposure time lapses occasionally. Even with 3 seconds between shutter close, and shutter open, the card keeps up just fine. There is really only lag from the camera. This car will write faster than a budget DSLR can keep up with. As far as transfer speeds, they are as advertised. I paired this with a Kingston USB 3.0 High Speed card reader which allows this card to function as fast as intended.  I have absolutely no complaints about this card.
customer_reviews.author: James JamesonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: close to spec, but not the old sanDisk anymore. (And awful support)
customer_reviews.text: Managed to get consistent 90MB/s reads, exactly as claimed, but only 75MB/s writes on average. (using a SDHC UHS II reader on usb3). SanDisk used to have a very confusing wide mix of products, but they never lied that much (over 12%) on the label claims. Edit: sandisk contacted via amazon to contact their support to understand the slow speeds. the support person just gives me canned answers. "try usb 3". "try another reader". "try a UHS-1 reader if the USH-2 didn't get the speed". One less star for that.
customer_reviews.author: G. B.

customer_reviews.title: Working great for 4k videos and raw images on sony a7iii
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. No performance issues... Update 5-29-19 Been using for a year or more now with no issues. I mainly use this for recording 4K video to my Sony A7III. I've recorded hundreds of hours now and constantly transfer the data to my PC and edit the videos for youtube. Not the fastest transfer speeds but it hasn't missed a beat yet so i ordered another one. Definitely order one. Great value for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Cj Rich

customer_reviews.title: Stores stuff as touted.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted in a Panasonic Lumix camera. I have taken many photos, and all of them are still there. What more can be said of a storage device than that it stores stuff as designed. Because of the crappy software that came with the camera, I pop out the chip and plug it directly into my computer, so I can download only the files I want to download, and not the entire range. Maybe someday I will find a photo software I like, but no luck so far. Maybe the way over-teched camera will do that for me, but that would require reading the manual which is heresy. Treating the photos as files works OK.
customer_reviews.author: T. Richards

customer_reviews.title: Nice, reliable fast card for DSLR's
customer_reviews.text: I had the slightly slower bit still great 45m, 32GB SanDisk Extreme card for my T3i and took over 20,000 shots on it with no problem at all. Still have it as backup. When I got my T6i I started shooting a RAW+jpeg, each shot and 32GB wasn't quite enough sometimes. Got this 64GB, 95m card which is even faster. It works great, just passed 10,000 pictures taken (20,000 actual images stored) in 3 months without a hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Yellow Tab = Fake card.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into Sony A7iii and can not record 4k or 1080p 120fps. Exact same cards of the same brand and "extreme Pro U3 10 rating work flawlessly at 100bits. This comes up with an error message after multiple reformat. Upon searching forums, there is a similar thing found. The "scandisk" logo does not look the same as pictured and the tab to lock the card is YELLOW and not grey. So it is also not the same card as pictured. DO NOT BUY. FAKE CARDS! I am printing return label as I type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit Circulation
customer_reviews.text: It appears that I received a counterfeit. As soon as I saw it, the packaging seemed faded to me. The yellow switch on the side of the card also seemed off because these are supposed to have gray switches. Also the front facing sticker on the card looks offset. I looked at some other reviews and they confirm all of the same qualities being counterfeit. Really disappointed, will most definitely be returning.
customer_reviews.author: mgx42

customer_reviews.title: SDXC for XAVC S video recording on the a6000
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a Sony a6000, since the XAVC S video format added by a recent firmware upgrade requires the SDXC-type SD card. The latest CrystalDiskMark 5.1.0, over a USB3 Kingston media adapter, shows 83 MB/s sequential read and 78 MB/s seq. write. This should be fast enough, so I'm very pleased with this performance. I'm running anti-virus and had many applications open, so your mileage may vary. The short video I took was smooth, with no dropouts or other problems that I could see. Note that the SanDisk white cardboard envelope packaging stated it was an "SDSXPA-064G, ExtremePro, SDHC, 95MB/s, UHS, Envelope, Amazon FFP, AM".
customer_reviews.author: nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Disks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use with Nikon D3300 as a novice/hobbyist photographer. The disk works perfectly, is fast and stores plenty of images for my shoots. I try to keep at least three, 64 GB disks and two, 32 GB disks in my Beeway Memory Card holder ( ASIN B01ESSWXH2 ) ready to use. I learned early on that you can never have enough disks and I like the 64 and 32 GB's. They work great for me and my Nikon. I would, and will be buying more disks from this seller soon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this same brand and model in my HD prosumer ENG-style camcorder for a couple of years now, and because I now have a bunch of them, also in my Zoom H6 recorder, my ChromeBook (as extra storage) and several other SD card devices, and each card has worked flawlessly. 50 Mbps video recording, no problem. Many random reads and writes as an ad hoc HDD, no problem. Format it for Linux with the ext4 filesystem, and it really shines. The best praise that I can give a product of this type is that it's boring. This is boring. It has never given me anything other than just working. Not even one hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: Speed Daemon

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware of Sarake Flash Cards
customer_reviews.text: Both cards failed within days of first use. Unfortunately they were my back ups and the window for returns was long past. I could see one card failing, but too much of a coincidence that both cards failed. Something is not right with this batch of cards or this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: EBV

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Fast at losing data.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for use in my Canon DSLR and have been using for about a month now. The Good: Plenty fast for me. Helps clear buffer for quicker shooting. Capacity allows me to take advantage of shooting digital, as opposed to film (take many pictures and save the good ones). The Bad: Just had one lose all the data on it. I can always recover using recovery tools, but for the price, I expected something more reliable. The card should not be erasing data. (This is not a seller review, I'm sure SanDisk will make it right. It's possible I just got a bad one.)
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great SD Card
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my Nikon DSLR and I can confidently state that it lets me snap more pictures rapidly. If you shoot in RAW and have a small-medium buffer (such as the Nikon d7100), you'll definitely benefit from this SD card. The only problem was that both my Linux and Windows computers didn't like it at first, but once I upgraded my SD card to USB converter, it worked fine. If you use a cheap SD card to USB converter that came with your camera, you might have that problem. Fortunately, there are really good converters available for under $10.
customer_reviews.author: F Charmane

customer_reviews.title: Card worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize how good this card was until I purchased a 256GB SanDisk Extreme Pro on eBay and the speed was clearly less than half of this card, and the (new) card failed on me the first time I tried to use it. Got a couple of these 64gig refurbished cards, and they've always worked perfectly, and speedily.
customer_reviews.author: Get in my Cart!

customer_reviews.title: Great for C4K the GH4
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a GH4 about 3 years ago when storage was expensive. Now that I have paying jobs relying on my equipment, I need a reliable card that doesn't have me swapping out cards every 30 minutes, and (more importantly) can handle the high bit rate codec (100 and 200 Mbps) without choking up and dropping my files. This card holds about 2 hours and 50 minutes of Cinema 4K 100Mbps video.
customer_reviews.author: John Gott

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure other companies make good stuff, but I've been using SanDisk for many
customer_reviews.text: I only buy SanDisk products for my photography. I'm sure other companies make good stuff, but I've been using SanDisk for many, many years, and I've never had a corrupt disk or any errors along the way. I rarely devote myself to a single brand, but when it comes to memory where my client's photos are on the line, I won't put anything else in my camera. I'm using the SDXC as a secondary card on my Canon 5D Mark IV, along with a SanDisk CF Card.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Bertram

customer_reviews.title: Defective Card
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received a 128GB card for my camera 46 days ago. I have used it a few times with no issues. Last night after a shoot, I plugged it into my pc to find out it was no longer working. The computer and camera could no longer read the card. After some research, it appears to have simply stopped working. Not only was the footage from my shoot lost, but according to their policy, the return window is only 30 days. Thankfully I contacted Amazon and am receiving a replacement. If that is defective as well then I am going to blame the company.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix Wild

customer_reviews.title: Please do yourself a favor and *AVOID THIS CARD LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!!*
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this card to take pictures on my wife PhD hooding ceremony. During the day everything went well on camera. However the next morning when I connected the card to my laptop, there were zero pictures.. Zero!! I tried my desktop and then my camera also. I’m very upset over this. I purchased what I thought to be the best. This product deserves a -5 stars in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah James Jr

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk
customer_reviews.text: SanDisk has been good. Maybe Samsung is better for certain things, like thumbdrives for OS installation, but I've never had a problem with the SD cards. This one is for an audio recorder that I haven't used yet but using another one in a mirrorless camera and yet another in an old video recorder. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Hexspa

customer_reviews.title: All you need for speed!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in an Olympus Digital Camera, and the write speed in conjunction with a 9 frame per second shooting is what everbody wishes for. Just below movie speed. Of course it works perfectly for shooting movies, too. There is a huge difference in speed from low cost SD Cards, I have quite a few SD Cards, and this is noticeably faster without the need for test equipment. It's not that cheap but for the results it is totally worth it. It will not improve your images, but is perfect for the higher frame rate cameras mostly, and will improve taking HD Movies. I would only buy this now, after some high speed shoots.
customer_reviews.author: Sandia Keith

customer_reviews.title: Needed for 4K video and 50MB RAW photo files
customer_reviews.text: Who needs 128GB? Well, the new cameras are shooting 4K video and the new DSLRs have 50MP sensors, and hence, 50MB RAW files with each snap, so having 128 GB is good for long shoots, time lapses, and anyother application. I have had exactly one of these fail in using dozens over decades. They are superb. See the '10' in the circle, thats imporant, thats a fast read/write speed. Buy THis!
customer_reviews.author: Mike90125

customer_reviews.title: Perfect capacity at a near perfect price
customer_reviews.text: Did lots of research looking for one card that was reasonably priced and had enough space for a hobbyist photographer like myself. After much thought, I bought this one and so far, it has worked out very well. Good amount of capacity for the price. Worth buying in my eyes, but you have to decide for yourself if it fits your use and your desire for capacity. This one was a perfect fit for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: brian d. bouvier

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic memory.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic memory. I use this with my Nikon D3300 and it works unbelievably. When shooting on continuous it runs flawlessly and has more shots and longer duration than the camera's posted statistics (I was surprised too. That's why I took several trials. Always proved true). I've also never had any issues with SanDisk. I know that every photographer dreads the "dead card" that happens to every card eventually but I have yet to experience it. True I'm not in a studio every day but as a amateur I do take LOTS of pictures (which annoys my wife to no end when we're trying to explore the outdoors). Bottom line? Great company. Amazing product. I'll buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Beaker

customer_reviews.title: The worst part is I bought two and it is past ...
customer_reviews.text: The tab on mine is yellow and is not a real sandisk... lost ~70 pictures from trip before I bought I legit card from a local camera shop, and realized what had happened. I did not use the camera much prior to my trip, and it does take pictures (slowly and sometimes with an unable to store image error) up to 32 gb. After that, all files are unrecognizable and transferred at 2mb a second. The worst part is I bought two and it is past the return time.
customer_reviews.author: Grocket

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product and with excellent quality. I received it very quickly. I bought this product to replace the current product I’m using in the same category and I must say that it definitely does the job better than I ever would’ve thought. Packaging, materials are all top notch and above my exceptions. I found this product by accident and decided to give it a shot and I couldn’t be happier. It’s lightweight and durable. I don’t believe I will be switching products anytime soon. If you’re contemplating on buying this product I’d definitely give it a shot, I don’t think you will be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Product itself is great but I also received a fake one the first ...
customer_reviews.text: Product itself is great but I also received a fake one the first time I purchased it. Until I saw one of the reviews warning about the fake cards, then I realized I was also a victim. Unfortunately passed the return period so Amazon did not accept the return. Therefore bought again and the second was genuine and fast. For most people, this card is overkill.
customer_reviews.author: LesPaulGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great, Reliable, Fast Card
customer_reviews.text: In my experience all the brand name SD cards work well--provided you get a Class 10. However, I have always had great reliability with SanDisk. They seem to stand behind their products. Whenever possible, I prefer SanDisk cards, but have also bought others that might have hit a more favorable price/speed target at the time. These extreme pro cards have become so much cheaper that I can't imagine reason to use anything else. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Spaceguppy

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Enough!
customer_reviews.text: This works well enough, meaning it does what it is supposed to. The only annoyance I have is that the Read/Write Lock tab moves very easy and it usually takes me 2-3 times putting it in my camera before I get it in without locking the Read/Write tab.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick C Best

customer_reviews.title: Best SD Flash Memory Out There
customer_reviews.text: Best flash card on the market and 32 GB is plenty of room for camera usage. Bought two just in case, but only ever have needed one even when shooting in RAW and JPG. However, the prices are so low I don't mind. This card holds about 500-600 photos while shooting in RAW and JPG with a Nikon D3300 at 24 MP. I format the card every time I put in my Nikon D3300 and have never had any issues with corruption. Have not tried to take video because I don't have a need for it, but based on the speeds it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: The Choosy MooseTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Super durable! I left one of these SD cards sticking out the back of a friend's iMac desktop computer, forgot it was there. My friend was adjusting the monitor angle and mashed the card into a wall. The card bent to a 45=-degree angle, and when I removed it from the computer, it retained that angle, but I straightened it out, stuck it back in the camera, and although there is a bit of a crease in it, it works just fine! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John Bratten

customer_reviews.title: Item as described and worry free
customer_reviews.text: When these arrived, I tested all six using two different programs: fakeflashtest.exe and h2testw.exe. The first program just does a quick write and read test and confirms the storage size. The second program does a much more thorough test and checks for errors (it took about 30 minutes to run h2testw.exe on each card). All checked out at 59.4 Gb and no errors. I have only used one of these a little bit and it works fine. I was more concerned with verifying the storage size and "health" of these cards. I think they'll work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great volume
customer_reviews.text: Held all the pictures and movies from my long vacation. Comes with a recovery tool that you need to download. This was a life saver when I accidentally deleted a movie.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Northwest

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazon took about 3 weeks to ship this item (2 weeks loner than the estimate) but when I called Amazon customer service they were helpful and upgraded my shipping for free so the Item still arrived on time. I love the camera! I have a lot to learn about using all of the settings and functions but I have already captured some gorgeous shots. I would definitely purchace extra batteries because this camera uses them faster than my old Nikon. This Camera came with a camera strap and one battery with a charger. No SD card included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my Canon 70D at max resolution (23MP) + raw and I can shoot pictures at max Frames per sec without much lagging - there are times I cant download all the pictures from the camera between shoots so they remain in the card - I think the last time I checked (3/18) the count was just under 10K pictures
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great card for modern cameras
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! I bought this for my Sony RX90IV. The Sony can fire a number of shots in burst mode and this card keeps up with the camera with every shot. Once I bought the card, I went to the Netherlands and Belgium for a week. Needless to say I took over a thousand shots. There was plenty of room on the card for my California trip. Transfers from the card to my iPad and Computer were clean and without incident. This is a great card for anyone going on a vacation. BUT while on vacation do take a moment each day to back up your pictures. Better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: fab0720

customer_reviews.title: Serious Photographers Dream
customer_reviews.text: If you are a serious photographer, especially anything to do with action or motion then you want this memory card. It has a read/write of 95MB/s so it wastes no time in saving your shots to the card and keeping your buffer clear on the camera. Shooting in burst mode or even a spray and pray keeps with up with you without any issues. All photos look great, no jamming, no slowing down due to buffer overload. The price is right, it comes in frustration free packaging so pull the strip, pop in the camera, format and you are ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: KMSROX

customer_reviews.title: One of the top of the line SD cards, made for fast running cameras or camcorders.
customer_reviews.text: They keep making them with more memory and faster, but you can only deal with what is on the market at the time. This one is a Pro. 95Mb/s (quite fast, along with the U3, and 10) makes it built for premium fast cameras or camcorders, very nice unit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, plentiful storage. A little Pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my OMD camera. It works for video and photo. Plenty of space for my use. When I plug it into my laptops card reader, the Adobe Bridge import is the fastest I have ever seen. Of course, I have been tethering camera's though USB for years, so that's probably the difference. The complaint is on the price. 64gb should be pennies by now, not thirty dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: This card is fake. very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This card is fake af! I ordered 2 of them- first one cannot be read by my camera, second one worked once then started having read error. a 30gb copy from the card to an ssd drive took 40 mins when its read. I had this ship to my aunt in the US and now Im stuck with 2 useless card. very disappointed. This is my first amazon fail.
customer_reviews.author: murk

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it's not a fake, and it's a Great card.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a verified refurbished one of these and I now use it as my main card for my Canon 60D. Absolutely fantastic little device. I plan on using it on every film shoot, and if I were to upgrade to a new camera I know it's brilliant for 4K capable cameras by using it with a friend's GH4. I've been using this for a few months now. I have absolutely no complaints or overheating issues. MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A VERIFIED CARD. You can call SanDisk and they'd be more than happy to help! Really easy to check.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best write speed I could find.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Nikon D7200 for it's write speed. I won't go into techy stuff because I'm not talented like that. But I do know that your high speed camera with 100 shots before going into buffer, needs a high writing card. This goes for and camera or other device that would need a high write speed. This is much more expensive but it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: ItsAMe_Mario

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my Sony HD camcorder! My previous Sony camcorder had a 60GB internal hardware, so did not use a SD card. My newer camcorder does have a large harddrive, so needed a SD card for recording concerts, school events and conferences. The camcorder records in HDTV quality which means reading/writing data in larger amounts. I was apprehensive at first, but this works great! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Diesel

customer_reviews.title: copying files it has a good cache, files were written up to 65 MB/s ...
customer_reviews.text: This was for my new nikon camera, after trying a cheap sd card, I noticed that the burst mode where it was slow is when the camera try to write in the SD memory, so after a quick review check this was the one I needed. so it was, in the computer, copying files it has a good cache, files were written up to 65 MB/s and after a few seconds it slowes down to 40 or 35 MB/s... still good, so in general I liked it, I'm not so sure on how to test to get the 95 MB/s, but for sure, this was fast at writing and reading.
customer_reviews.author: P. F. R. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk is Fake or Bad: Tested as low as 5 MBps for write
customer_reviews.text: Tested using BlackMagic Disk Speed Test (see image) as low as 5 MBps for write and at the most 17 MBps read. Either this is a fake, or bad card. I purchased this card two months before an event and now cannot return it. If I receive a replacement from the seller, I'll be happy to update the comment.
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: Check out prices
customer_reviews.text: So how did this Sandisk card go from a price of apx. $16. to apx. $111. each? I don't get it. Lexar doesn't seem as reliable as it used to be. IMO PNY is not as high quality but if it is just for casual snaps it is fine and will generally save you a lot of money. If you are ever bored you might want to grab your camera and do test shots.
customer_reviews.author: mermaid 331

customer_reviews.title: Great Cards!
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these from several companies, and all worked flawlessly. Someone stole my flash memory card holder, every one of these cards full of photos, and my heart is still broken over it. That aside, these cards from all of the brands worked perfectly in several different readers. I will copy and paste this review to the other cards that I bought. Please hold your photo cards sacred, protect them, or they will walk away in the hands of someone who cares about your memories far less than you do.
customer_reviews.author: OdylicMaven

customer_reviews.title: Product works well I’ve had no problems for the past 10 years
customer_reviews.text: Product works well I’ve had no problems for the past 10 years
customer_reviews.author: LauraAW25

customer_reviews.title: Fast card.
customer_reviews.text: After taking it from it's package I placed it in myand shot at high speed continuous shooting to see how many shots I could take before I hit the buffer. I am also using this camera in with a. While shooting in burst I noticed that the card would hit it's buffer after about 6 photos, shooting in RAW+JPEG and also to both cards. I have yet to test it saving to a single card at a time, but I am assuming I may be able to achieve a higher buffer while doing so. So far this proves to be a great product and worth the money. May update this review as I do more tests.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Shucks,where were you all my life.Nice to have you!
customer_reviews.text: Some people can't cut the package.So Amazon does it for you.This is a 600x write card plain and simple.It works well in my camera and seems to have a lifetime warranty so save your receipt.The nifty thing is it has all kind of protection from hot and cold,and wet.I,am just wondering if it will survive the washing machine where I seem to forget leaving stuff in my pockets.The whole reason I I went extreme pro for this card in the shuffle, is I don't want to bog down my cameras "buffer".Halyaluya!This makes me happy.Get happy.recommended,and the price is right if you need this card.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Duchin

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk 32 GB 90 MB's per second SD class 10
customer_reviews.text: I own a Canon Vixia HF R200 camcorder. I was using SanDisk 32-GB 45 MB's per second. These are 90 MB's per second. I am not noticing any difference. But I should add more lights to my video projects. And will know more. I've been doing HD and JPGS with this camcorder. And its a good camcorder. Bought it here at Amazon, years ago. I would suggest moving from camcorder--to Digital 35mm if higher quality is necessary. (DSLR)
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Mocarski

customer_reviews.title: Caution
customer_reviews.text: Card was dead straight out of the packaging. Unable to read, recognize or format in my PC, Laptop or my Nikon d750. Unfortunately I didnt try the card for several weeks after purchase, so I am stuck with it. ADVICE - test cards immedialy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan F.

customer_reviews.title: No Issues, Fast Transfer For Post Production
customer_reviews.text: A quality card, have been using it for 6 months with no issues. Would recommend and will be purchasing another. After 6 months using on 2 cameras, and various computers it has not disappointed. Again a quality product I have come to trust.
customer_reviews.author: True Review

customer_reviews.title: Fast but not the strongest.
customer_reviews.text: Has been the fastest-writing card for quite some time now (most cards that read fast still write much slower); it looks like only the UHS-2 cards will be faster. The faster write speed makes a significant difference for the Canon 6D and probably most cameras of the same era--the buffer clears *much* faster than with other cards. However, it is fairly fragile. Not more fragile than other SD cards I've used, but I think perhaps this format just sucks compared to Compact Flash, which I used for many years without a failure.
customer_reviews.author: markshelby

customer_reviews.title: As fast as I have seen.
customer_reviews.text: The fastest SD card I have used, period. Have seen real life transfer of > 70 MB/s using aconnected to a Western Digital SuperSpeed USB 3.0 PCI Express (PCIe) Card. Have used two units simultaneously on Nikon D7000/D7100/D600 set for RAW on slot 1 and JPEG on slot 2, and there was no difference when compared to RAW only (with a single card or slower ones, usually the speed drops considerably if RAW + JPEG), certifying that this card is the only one I have tested that is NOT a bottleneck for such cameras. Pros. FAST. Cons. Expensive.
customer_reviews.author: pfeitosa

customer_reviews.title: Best SD Card Out - A Must for Professionals!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my recently returned from vacation to Washington DC. This is the creme de la creme of SD cards, there are only a few (very expensive comparably) SD cards out there that beat the speeds of this card. If your shooting in ANYTHING over 2.7K video, this card is a MUST for your film kit. It will never let you down, and you will never get messed up footage, nor will you ever be disappointed with the read speed (it transfers to my PC pretty fast). I will never buy a different SD card again. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David DeuceTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Bought after extensive research.
customer_reviews.text: I did a significant amount of research and read several benchmarks with specific camera models before I bought this puppy. So far has performed exactly like I hoped it would. You really don't know what you're missing until you actually have it. Instant pic preview and awesome fast read/write, shooting RAWs. no regrets so far.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Barajas

customer_reviews.title: 'Extreme'-ly Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for for my camera. No problems with this product at all. Write speed is great and unloads into computer at an acceptable rate. No glitches, can reformat in camera each time and the card works properly each time. Quality of images are just as good every time as well. I would buy this again, when I need to have a back-up, extra cards for vacation, or if I buy a new camera and need a card.
customer_reviews.author: Firtree

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, speed is very good and doesn't slow down my 10 fps shooting while in my camera and transfers everything very fast while it is attached in my MacBook's card reader slot. Good quality! No complaints. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Capt.Jim

customer_reviews.title: Speed claims were accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fast WRITE speed to max out my camera's burst mode. This card does the trick. The V30 rating means it writes at least that fast. It can go faster. Many times the speeds cards are advertised with are the READ speeds. That rating doesn't mean much out in the field, only when you're back home transferring data. Make sure you get the WRITE speed you need for your device to go as fast as it can.
customer_reviews.author: Marzman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this card is really fast! I use this in my Nikon D3100 Digital SLR camera. I have the camera set to the highest "Fine" setting and when I press the button to take a picture, it is immediately transferred to the memory card within a fraction of a second! It is basically instantaneous. Also, when I was using a "slower" card, it would take about 5 seconds per picture in uploading to the computer; example, 30 pictures would take about 150 seconds (2.5 minutes) to upload. With THIS card, it took about 5 seconds to upload all 30 pictures! You will love the speed of this card!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RickTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: MORE MUSIC!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this guy! I only have a 512 SSD hard drive and as a DJ, that space filled up quick! I leave this expanded memory in the laptop permanently and haven't had any issues with it after months of continual use. Add memory to your computer! Super bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my cup of tea.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what it is with sandisk cards. They work great, but I have had more sandisk cards fail than any other. I try to make sure I only have authentic ones. The only reason I keep buying them is because one of my cameras doesn't work with anything else. Thinking about spending several hundred dollars for an external recorder just to get away from the sandisk as cards. I like their harddrives. But I have cheap sd cards that get used way more, are treated worse and seem to have a better build quality and are more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Can go through the wash and still work! Not the fastest card w/RAW &high MP's.
customer_reviews.text: Using for my Sony a7riii camera. Shooting RAW and 42 MP's and still get a decent about of space. Not the fastest card. Slow buffering for burst shots. However, I accidentally threw it in wash and it still works great! Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Trista Jonk

customer_reviews.title: Great Memory Card for Non-Professional Photographer who takes pictures every now and then..
customer_reviews.text: Great memory card thus far for a new photographer. I did a bit of research and I wanted a card large enough for photos and videos but I also wanted it to be a faster card so that it would not take me ages to transfer content between my new FujiFilm X-T20 AND my computer. No complaints whatsoever thus far. I would have given it 5 stars if it was just a tad bit cheaper..!
customer_reviews.author: Kautious Nupe

customer_reviews.title: fast card
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Can shot 1.7k pictures on high settings in RAW on 24mp camera. Also, have a continuous shot of 5 pics with buffer. Previous card I was using could only do 3 continuous shots. Just an FYI. A lot of negative ratings do not seem to understand memory cards. First, if you constantly reformat a card (just like a computer hard drive) it will fail and cause errors. Second, make sure the card you are buying is mfg approved for your device. Not all cards work for all devices.
customer_reviews.author: starsky costello

customer_reviews.title: Warp factor 9 Mr. Sulu
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a Sony A77 DSRL - capable of taking 24 megapixel photos at 12 fps. When I first got the camera, I used an older (2011 model). After taking 12 quick photos, I'd wait around 10 seconds for them to be processed / stored on the card. While the SanDisk Extreme Pro is rated for approx 4 times the speed of the Transcend (95 MB/s vs 25 MB/s), it feels much faster....When you're taking sports photos, the difference between 2-3 seconds and 9-12 seconds is HUGE. If you absolutely need the fastest SDHC memory around, get this one (9/5/12 - I'm sure there will be faster cards 3-12 months from now).
customer_reviews.author: Informed ConsumerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very fast card
customer_reviews.text: I've tried various cards over several years but this card very fast. I use a Pentax K-5 IIs and some of the corrections that can be applied can kill the speed of any card. Applying shadow, highlight, chromatic aberrations and horizon corrections at the same time would generally take 3-4 seconds with this card it appears to be well under 2 seconds. It could be much better if Pentax would upgrade to UHS 1. This was not a scientific test just observations with a stop watch (actually a kitchen timer), regardless, the card performs exceptionally well and I am very happy with it and it's worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: It did not work for my Nikon D3400 Camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card for my Nikon D3400 Camera but it kept saying memory card damaged when I took a photo (and this started occuring right out the box). By chance it saved a few pictures but the "Card may be damaged" message kept cutting me off while trying to take pictures. I bought a 32gb and it works fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahbeth

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I love the company!!! Their product has served me well, and on the one occasion when I had a failure, they jumped in fast and helped me resolve the issue.. So, first, the company has been good to me, the cards have mostly been good to me, and so far this card has been perfect for me.. I just got back from Scotland, and I shot the whole trip on this one card, with lots of room left over.. No card changes.. OH, but, I have two of these cards.. My camera holds two.. I use one card to back up the other.... Yes, I think this is a product you would love..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Better for a DSLR, not SLR
customer_reviews.text: This is great, but for bigger SLR cameras, 95 mb/s isn't fast enough so you can't shoot a ton of photos at once during an event that requires action-shots, because the processor is a bit too slow. Not bad though!
customer_reviews.author: Roya A.

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable but not as good as described
customer_reviews.text: I contacted SanDisk customer service and they verified my card to be authentic, although it once made me think it was fake. The card arrived in a very cheaply made envelop-like package, not the ones you usually see in BestBuy with well-designed cardboard and plastic padded packages with instructions and specs printed on it. I tested the read and write speed with AS SSD Benchmark and got an acceptable but not satisfying result: 80MB/s read and 50MB/s write. That's a 40MB/s cut from the claimed write speed. Maybe you still can do 24p FHD on it, but if you are going to shoot 60p FHD or 4K videos, you will definitely want to consider some faster cards.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Buy from Best Buy instead !!!!
customer_reviews.text: OK so I thought the bad reviews were just people who did not know how to use the memory card... This is in fact a fake card. I purchased the original one from Best Buy and compared it to this one. The one I purchased that Amazon was not only a little bit thicker which made it harder to take out of the camera it also was unreliable and capturing all of the photos that I took. Please do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Piceno

customer_reviews.title: very good buy
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my Canon 80D camera and it has worked for me a lot, I have not had any reading problems, it also comes in its case for rescuardo which I think is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

product_meta.title: SanDisk 16GB Extreme PRO SDHC UHS-I Card (SDSDXPA-016G-X46)
product_meta.description: Capacity:16GB| Package Type:Standard PackagingCompromise nothing with SanDisk Extreme Pro SDHC and SDXC UHS-I cards.
feature_bullets: Read Up To 90MB/s/ Write Up To 95MB/s
4K Ultra HD (3840 x 2160p); Full HD (1920 x 1080p)
Compatible with SDXC and SDXC-I (UHS-I) enabled host devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars10,674 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
